transcript.title: Beazley: Say One Thing, Do Another
transcript.content:
Mr Beazley's latest attempt to explain away his embarrassment about the contents of the Labor Government's submission in the Kruger Case has only worsened his predicament.

The fact is that the former government's submission used arguments similar to those that I used last week.

Nothing Mr Beazley said in Parliament or elsewhere today can gainsay the fact that he has been caught out with a blatant inconsistency.

He said one thing in government and a completely different thing in opposition.

2 June 1997
